intro: Clidemia tetraptera, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Clidemia tetraptera is often found in moist, shaded environments and is known for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
